issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Submit distributed shell application. Once the application turns to be RUNNING state, app master host should not be empty. In reality, it is empty.

==console logs==
distributedshell.Client: Got application report from ASM for, appId=12, clientToAMToken=null, appDiagnostics=, appMasterHost=, appQueue=default, appMasterRpcPort=0, appStartTime=1378505161360, yarnAppState=RUNNING, distributedFinalState=UNDEFINED,
fields.summary: Submitted distributed shell application shows appMasterHost = empty

comments.body: Trivial patch

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12606176/YARN-1167.1.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:red}-1 tests included{color}.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:red}-1 core tests{color}.  The patch failed these unit tests in hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-applications/hadoop-yarn-applications-distributedshell:

                  org.apache.hadoop.yarn.applications.distributedshell.TestDistributedShell

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/2058//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/2058//console

This message is automatically generated.
The test TestDistributedShell fails in the trunk. It can be tracked in this ticket. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/YARN-1251
Please add a simple test to validate this. One way to do this is to expose whatever ApplicationReport Client sees.
Added a test case

Please update ApplicationMaster document saying we are not listening on the port. Also tracking url today is empty. Update the document saying distributed shell application master has no implementation yet to support web content via trackingUrl.

{code}+    appMasterRpcPort = NetUtils.getFreeSocketPort();{code}
remove this as we are not listening on this port.
Update test to check port==0.
Remove rpcPort change
+1 lgtm. Thanks [~xgong]
